title: ADCC natural gas pipeline in Texas enters commercial service
keypoints: The ADCC Pipeline in Texas, a 40-mile natural gas pipeline, started commercial service on July 1, 2024.
It transports natural gas from Whistler Pipeline's Agua Dulce Header to Cheniere's Corpus Christi Liquefaction facility.
It provides approximately 1.7 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) of natural gas transportation capacity.
Enhances access to Permian and Eagle Ford gas volumes and supports U.S. LNG exports to global markets.
The pipeline is a joint venture: 70% owned by Whistler Pipeline LLC and 30% by a subsidiary of Cheniere Energy.

title: US natural gas prices ease
keypoints: US natural gas futures dropped about 1% to a six-week low due to rising output and lower demand forecasts.
The decrease in natural gas prices was influenced by less demand for liquefied natural gas (LNG) feedgas.
A federal judge blocked the Biden administration from pausing the approval of applications to export LNG, affecting the climate agenda.
In Texas, the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) reported that peak demand approached record levels due to a heat wave.
Next-day gas prices at the Waha hub in West Texas fell significantly, even turning negative due to pipeline constraints trapping gas in the Permian Shale.
This is the third instance within six days of Waha prices falling into negative territory during the current heat wave.

title: Natural Gas Futures Seesaw After Uninspiring EIA Print, Signs of Easing Demand
keypoints: August Nymex natural gas futures attempted to break a six-day losing streak but settled slightly negative.
The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) storage print failed to inspire the market.
Natural gas futures stumbled amid steady production levels and expectations for lighter mid-July demand.
Energy executives in the Rockies and Midcontinent forecast a more bullish outlook on natural gas prices by early 2025.
The Freeport LNG outage and moderated heat forecasts contributed to the slump in natural gas futures.
Strong production, hefty supplies in storage, and a demand-thwarting hurricane also influenced the natural gas forward prices.

title: Adnoc Gas awards $550mn EPC contracts for UAE gas pipe project
keypoints: ADNOC Gas awarded $550 million in EPC contracts for a gas pipeline project in the UAE.
The project is part of ADNOC's ongoing efforts to enhance its gas infrastructure and production capabilities.
